==German== ===Etymology=== From {{etyl|goh|de}} {{m|goh|wonēn}}, from {{etyl|gem-pro|de}} {{m|gem-pro|*wunaną}}, {{m|gem-pro|*wunēną}}, {{m|gem-pro|*wunajaną}}, {{m|gem-pro|*wunjaną||to love, wish}}, from {{etyl|ine-pro|de}} {{m|ine-pro|*wenh₁-||to wish, love}}. Compare {{cog|yi|וווינען}}, {{cog|osx|wunon}} ({{cog|nds|wanen}}), {{cog|nl|wonen}}, {{cog|ang|wunian}} ({{cog|en|wone}}). Compare {{m|de|gewohnt||accustomed}} to English {{m|en|wont}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈvoːnən/}} * {{a|Germany}} {{audio|de|De-wohnen.ogg}} * {{a|Austria}} {{audio|de|De-at-wohnen.ogg}} ===Verb=== {{de-verb-weak|wohnt|wohnte|gewohnt}} # {{lb|de|intransitive}} to [[live]], [[reside]], [[dwell]] {{gloss|to remain or be settled permanently, or for a considerable time}} # {{lb|de|intransitive}} to [[stay]] {{gloss|to remain in a place for a definite or short period of time}} ====Conjugation==== {{de-conj-weak|wohn|gewohnt|h}} ====Derived terms==== {{der-top}} * {{l|de|beiwohnen}} * {{l|de|Wohnheim}} * {{l|de|wohnlich}} {{der-mid}} * {{l|de|Wohnort}} * {{l|de|Wohnzimmer}} {{der-bottom}} ====Related terms==== * {{l|de|Einwohner}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}}
